description.heading: 1. Technical Field
description.p: The present invention relates to a transmission device and its component, and in particular, to an inner gear ring with variable tooth-number, the method of varying the tooth-number, and a variable transmission for vehicle composed of the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number.

There are two types of transmissions: variable (or multi-ratio) transmissions and continuously variable transmissions. Continuously variable transmissions can keep the motor in optimal working condition all the time so as to make the overall efficiency higher than the variable transmission. The existing continuously variable transmissions CVT, IVT both rely on friction to transfer power, so they are unsuitable for high power, heavy-duty vehicles or machines. Moreover, due to the presence of abrasion, the service life is shorter than that of variable transmission. In the existing art, a variable transmission generally includes no more than 16 shift gears. With more shift gears, the structure becomes more complicated, and volume, weight and cost are higher. Furthermore, a clutch is required when shifting gears, and power interruption and loss may take place during shifting, so it is not desirable to design too many shifts.

Reference may be made to WO 2006/122507 (Zhang), which constitutes the closest prior art, and US 2669885 (Fedri), which show variable transmissions in which the size of a gear is varied by inserting or withdrawing chain links.

The present invention aims at providing an inner gear ring with variable tooth-number and a variable transmission using the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number, which changes the transmission ratio of the planetary gear train through the tooth-number variation of the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number, thus realizing more steps of speeds than the existing multi-speed transmission.

The invention is defined in claim 1. Embodiments of the present invention are directed to an inner gear ring with variable tooth-number, comprising a pair of tapered discs disposed coaxially and capable of changing axial distance through relative movement, wherein the inner walls of said two tapered discs are facing each other, a curled rack composed of several teeth is set between the two facing walls of the tapered discs, cogs are set on said teeth, the rear section of the rack consists of narrow teeth, the front section of the rack composed of wide teeth is provided with gear ring connecting interfaces for the access of the rear section of the rack, the rear section of the rack passing through the connecting interfaces forms a circular inner gear ring, the two side surfaces of the inner gear ring are closely contacted with the inner walls of the two tapered discs, the inner walls of the two tapered discs are provided with grooves fit for wide teeth, thus to make the inner gear ring formed maintain a circular ring shape, the tooth-number of the inner gear ring that the rear section of the rack is in or out of the inner gear ring through the gear ring connecting interfaces varies with the change of the relative distance of the two tapered discs.

Corresponding methods are also claimed. In method embodiments, varying the tooth-number for the inner gearing with variable tooth-number of the present invention may be achieved in that the inner gear ring is engaged with and driven by the outer planetary gear of the planetary gear train through revolution, the rear section of the rack is driven to push teeth into or draw teeth out from the inner gear ring after the outer planetary gear passes through the gear ring connecting interfaces during rotation, and meanwhile the two tapered discs are driven to make relative movement along the axial direction to change the adjacent distance, so as to ensure that the inner gear ring is contacted with the inner walls of the tapered discs all the time, and closely contacted between the facing walls of the tapered discs in the form of circular ring shape, the increase or decrease of tooth-number of the inner gear ring is completed before the outer planetary gear rotates to the gear ring connecting interfaces for the next time.

With respect to the variable transmission using the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number of the present invention, a technical solution is a variable transmission comprising a main shift part and a shift mechanism, the main shift part comprises at least an inner gear ring with variable tooth-number which is connected with the shift mechanism, the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number is engaged with a main planetary gear train disposed coaxially, the transmission ratio of the main planetary gear train varies with the change of the tooth-number of the inner gear ring.

The abovementioned inner gear ring with variable tooth-number may be composed of several teeth and a pair of tapered discs disposed coaxially, wherein cogs are set on said teeth, the teeth connected mutually constitutes a curled rack, the rear section of the rack is narrow teeth, the front section is wide teeth on which gear ring connecting interfaces for the access of the narrow teeth are provided, the rear section of the rack passing through the connecting interfaces forms a circular inner gear ring, the two facing walls of the tapered discs are inward concave, the two side surfaces of the inner gear ring are closely contacted between the facing walls of the two tapered discs, and the inner walls of the tapered discs are provided with concave faces fit for the wide teeth, thus to make the inner gear ring form maintain a circular ring shape, the rear section of the rack is connected with the shift mechanism which drives the rear section of the rack to be in or out of the inner gear ring through the gear ring connecting interfaces so as to change the tooth-number of the inner gear ring.

The abovementioned main planetary gear train may comprise a main sun gear, an inner planetary gear and an outer planetary gear, wherein the main sun gear is coaxially disposed between the tapered discs, the inner planetary gear is engaged with the main sun gear through the bracket of main planetary gear carrier, the shafts of the inner, outer planetary gears are articulated via the planetary gear connecting arm and the two gears keep engaged with each other, the outer planetary gear is engaged with the inner gear ring, the transmission ratio between the main planetary gear carrier and the main sun gear varies with the change of the tooth-number of the inner gear ring.
The outer planetary gear may be directly engaged with the inner gear ring through the resistance generated by loads and rotating centrifugal force, or through a supporting mechanism.

The supporting mechanism of the outer planetary gear may consist of a supporting arm, a supporting sliding block and a supporting sliding rail; one end of the supporting arm is connected to the connecting arm of the planetary gear, the other end is articulated with the sliding block, the articulation is coaxial with the outer planetary gear; the supporting sliding rail and the shaft of the tapered discs are on the same face and the rail can rotate around the shaft of the tapered discs, the included angle between the supporting sliding rail and the shaft is equal to the semi-tapered angle with the inner walls of the tapered discs and moves axially with the tapered disc of the same side; the sliding block slides along the supporting sliding rail, and the outer planetary gear is engaged with the inner gear ring all the time.
The main sun gear of the variable transmission may be connected with the power input part and the main planetary gear carrier is connected with the power output part, or vice versa.

A post planetary gear train may be configured between the planetary gear train and power output part. wherein the post planetary gear train is a single pinion type planetary gear train, and is composed of a sun gear, a gear ring and a planetary gear carrier; the main sun gear is connected with the sun gear, the main planetary gear carrier is linked with the gear ring; the main sun gear or main planetary gear carrier is connected with the power input part, the planetary gear carrier of the post planetary gear train is connected with the power output part.

A traction device may be set between the shift mechanism and inner gear ring with variable tooth-number, wherein the traction device comprises a tooth guided grooved rail and a traction rod; the tooth guided grooved rail is arranged along the tangent direction of the inner gear ring and connected with the first tooth at the front section of the rack, and makes radial movement with the tooth; the traction rod is arranged on the plane of the shaft section in the center of the inner gear ring and along the direction with an arctan (0.5/π) angle with the tooth guiding grooved rail, and connected with the narrow teeth at the rear section of the rack, and moves along this direction under the traction of the shift mechanism; with the movement of the traction rod along the setting direction, the rear section of the rack through the gear ring connecting interfaces by means of drawing out or pushing in teeth is in or out of the inner gear ring via the sliding in the tooth guiding grooved rail, and drives the tooth guiding grooved rail to make radial movement along the first tooth at the front section of the rack so as to adapt to the change of the radius of the inner gear ring.

The shift mechanism may be synchronous stepping shift mechanism. It comprises driver plates; round pins are configured on the driver plates; several grooves fit for the round pins are mounted on the traction rod, and the rotating diameter of the round pins is equal to the distance between the adjacent grooves.

The favorable effect of the present invention is that, the inner gear ring of the variable tooth-number adopts curled, open type flexible rack fit for the pair of tapered discs, so the change of tooth-number can be easily realized through pushing, drawing out the rear section of the rack, or through the transmission ratio between the self-rotation and revolution of the outer planetary gear of the planetary gear train engaged with the rack. While the variable transmission using the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number is provided with more steps of speeds than the existing multi-speed transmission. With the simple structure, the number of the steps of speeds can only affect the volume (no impact on the structure) and the shift over 16 steps can be easily achieved. Therefore, this variable transmission can make the motor maintain nearly the highest efficiency working condition all the time. Moreover, it is engaged type power transmission, so it can be applied in high power, heavy duty vehicles or machines, can realize shifting with low power loss and no power interruption, and the service life is also longer than friction type continuously variable transmission.

heading.b: BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE SEVERAL VIEWS OF THE DRAWINGS

description.p: With reference to FIGS. 1∼8, the variable transmission disclosed by this Embodiment comprises a main shift part and a post planetary gear train 22, the main shift part is connected with the shift mechanism through the traction device, wherein the main shift part comprises an inner gear ring with variable tooth-number B, a main sun gear 11, an inner planetary gear 12, an outer planetary gear 13 and a main planetary gear carrier 14. The post planetary gear train 22 is a single pinion type (Simpson Type) and is composed of a sun gear 23, a gear ring 24 and a planetary gear carrier 25. The main planetary gear carrier 14 is linked with the power input part 20 and the gear ring 24 of the post planetary gear train 22, the main sun gear 11 is connected with the sun gear 23 of the post planetary gear train 22, the planetary gear carrier 25 of the post planetary gear train 22 is linked with the power output part 21.

As shown in FIGS. 1∼4, the inner gear ring with variable tooth-number B comprises: a pair of tapered discs 7 , 8 disposed coaxially and with two facing walls, and a curled rack 3 composed of teeth 1 linked mutually. The two tapered discs 7, 8 which (tapered discs 7, 8) are connected by screws 19 with opposite threads on both ends move along with the rotation of the screws 19 so as to change the distance between the two tapered discs 7, 8. Cogs 2 are set on said teeth 1. Both sides of the teeth are the inclined planes fit for the inner walls 9 of the tapered discs 7, 8. The rear section 5 of the rack 3 is composed of narrow teeth. The front section 4 of the rack 3 is provided with several wide teeth on which gear ring connecting interfaces A for the access of the narrow teeth are set, wherein the gear ring connecting interface A on the first to the fifth wide teeth is in the form of opening "n", the interface A on the sixth wide tooth is an enclosed block shape, the rear section 5 of the rack 3 constitutes the inner gear ring B after passing through the gear ring connecting interfaces A; wherein the cogs 2 of the narrow teeth are set in the middle of the teeth end face, the cogs 2 for several wide teeth at the gear ring connecting interfaces A are arranged on the left and right sides of the teeth end face, with a clearance equivalent to the width of the cogs 2 of the narrow teeth in the middle, so as to keep the integrity of the cogs at the gear ring connecting interfaces A for the inner gear ring 3. Concave faces 10 fit for the wide teeth are set in the inner walls 9 of the tapered discs 7, 8, the inner gear ring B is clamped between the inner walls 9 of the tapered discs 7, 8 and the concave faces 10 so as to maintain the circular ring shape.

As shown in FIGS. 5∼7, the main sun gear 11 is coaxially set between the two tapered discs 7, 8, the inner planetary gear 12 is engaged with the main sun gear 11 through the planetary gear carrier bracket 14; the connecting arm 15 of the planetary gear is articulated with the shafts of the outer, inner planetary gears 12, 13 respectively so as to keep the engagement of the inner, outer planetary gears 12, 13; the supporting mechanism of the outer planetary gear D is applied to keep the engagement of the outer planetary gear 13 with the inner gear ring B. When the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the gear ring section composed of narrow teeth, the cogs in the middle of the end face are engaged with the outer planetary gear 13; when the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the gear ring section composed of wide teeth at the gear ring connecting interfaces A, the cogs on both sides of the tooth end faces are engaged with the outer planetary gear 13; when the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the first wide tooth 6 of the gear ring connecting interfaces A, the outer planetary gear 13 is engaged with a cog in the middle of the narrow teeth and cogs on both sides of the wide tooth 6 simultaneously. Therefore, in the whole rotating period, the outer planetary gear 13 keeps engagement with the gear ring B, free from jump discontinuity.

As shown in FIG. 5, the supporting mechanism D of the outer planetary gear comprises a supporting arm 16, a supporting sliding block 18 and a supporting sliding rail 17; one end of the supporting arm 16 is connected to the connecting arm 15 of the planetary gear, the other end is articulated with the sliding block 18, the articulation is coaxial with the outer planetary gear 13; the supporting sliding rail 17 and the shaft of the tapered discs 7, 8 are on the same face and the rail can rotate around the shaft of the tapered discs 7, 8, the included angle between the supporting sliding rail and the shaft is equal to the semi-tapered angle with the inner walls of the tapered discs 7, 8 and moves axially with the tapered disc 8 of the same side; the sliding block 18 slides along the supporting sliding rail 17, so as to ensure that the outer planetary gear 13 is engaged with the inner gear ring B all the time.

Wherein, the traction device connecting the shift mechanism and inner gear ring with variable tooth-number B comprises a tooth guiding grooved rail 26 and a traction rod 27. As shown in FIGS. 6∼8, the tooth guiding grooved rail 26 is arranged along the tangent direction of the inner gear ring B and connected with the first tooth 6 at the front section of the rack 3. The rear section 5 of the rack 3 passes through the gear ring connecting interfaces A, and slides in the tooth guiding grooved rail 26 so as to be in or out of the gear ring B. The tooth guiding grooved rail 26 can move radially along with the fist tooth 6. The traction rod 27 is arranged on the plane of the shaft section in the center of the inner gear ring B and along the direction with an arctan (0.5/π) angle of about 9.043 with the tooth guiding grooved rail 26, and moves along this direction, wherein the traction rod 27 is connected with the last tooth at the rear section 5 of the rack 3; with the traction of the shift mechanism, the traction rod 27 moves along the setting direction, draws out from or pushes into the rear section 5 of the rack 3 to be in or out of the inner gear ring B, and drives the tooth guiding grooved rail 26 to make radial movement along the first tooth 6 so as to adapt to the change of the radius of the inner gear ring B. The screws 19 linking the two tapered discs 7, 8 rotate with the movement of the traction rod 27, thus changing the distance between the two tapered discs 7, 8.

Wherein, the shift mechanism is synchronous stepping shift mechanism C. It comprises driver plates 29, 30; round pins 31 are configured on the driver plates 29, 30; several grooves 28 are mounted on the traction rod 27, and the diameter of the round pins 31 rotating around the shift driver plates (29, 30) is equal to the distance between the adjacent shift grooves 28, the distance of the grooves 28=( teeth spacing of the inner gear ring B) × [1+1/(2π)2]1/2, namely, the movement of traction rod 27 by a distance of grooves 28 just push or draw out a tooth into or from the inner gear ring B. The shift driver plates 29, 30 are driven by the rotation of the supporting sliding rail 17 around the shaft of the main sun gear 11, and the rotating speed of the shift driver plates 29, 30 is a half of that of the supporting sliding rail 17 (= 1/2 of the quantity of outer planetary gears). When the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the first tooth 6 of the gear ring connecting interface A, the round pins 31 are just at the position aligning with the opening of the grooves 28; two shift driver plates 29, 30 can make axial movement through a mechanical or electromagnetic device. When the shift driver plates 29, 30 are in the original location, the round pins 31 are not in contact with the traction rod 27. As shown in FIG. 8, the rotating directions of the two shift driver plates 29, 30 are opposite. When the driver plate 29 rotates clockwise and the traction rod 27 work, the traction rod 27 moves in top-right direction as shown in FIG. 8; when the driver plate 30 rotates anticlockwise and the traction rod 27 work, the traction rod 27 moves in bottom-left direction as shown in FIG. 8. Therefore, when shifting is required, the shift driver plate 29 or 30 is pushed to the traction rod 27 through a mechanical or electromagnetic device, with the rotation of the driver plate 29 or 30, the round pins 31 enter into the grooves 28 to poke the traction rod 27 for movement, after the round pins 31 rotates out from the grooves 28, the shift driver plate 29 or 30 returns to the original location, round pins 31 deviate from the traction rod 27; during the shifting above, after the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the first tooth 6 of the gear ring connecting interfaces A, the traction rod 27 is moved to push or draw out teeth into or from the inner gear ring B, and drives the screws 19 to rotate to change the distance between the two tapered discs 7, 8. Before the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the first tooth 6 of the gear ring connecting interfaces A for the next time, the following are completed: increase or decrease the tooth-number of the inner gear ring B, and change the relative distance between the two tapered discs 7, 8, keep the inner gear ring B in contact with the inner walls of the tapered discs 7, 8 and maintain circular ring shape.

As shown in FIGS. 6, 7, the tooth-number of the main sun gear 11 Z11=14, that of both the inner planetary gear 12 and outer planetary gear 13 is 14, and the tooth-number ZB of the inner gear ring B is at least 46, 69 at most. Suppose the tooth-number of the gear ring for the post planetary gear train is Z24 and that of the sun gear for the post planetary gear train is Z23, if: 49-Z11/Z11>Z24/Z23>48-Z11/Z11

When the tooth-number of the inner gear ring is 49∼69, the output and input rotating directions are opposite, 21 steps of speeds are available, which will be used as forward shifts; when the tooth-number of the inner gear ring B is 46∼48, the output and input rotating directions are the same, 3 steps of speeds are available, which will be used as the reverse shift.

If the tooth-number of the gear ring 24 for the post planetary gear 22 Z24=40 and that of the sun gear 23 for the post planetary gear 22 Z23=16, when the tooth-number of the inner gear ring B is 50∼69, they are the 1st∼20th forward shifts respectively; when the tooth-number of the inner gear ring B is 48, 47, 46, they are the 1st∼3rd reverse shifts respectively; when the tooth-number of the inner gear ring B is 49, it is shift "0", namely, brake for locking, at this time, the output speed keeps 0 no matter how much rotating speed you input. The transmission ratio of various shifts is: Input rotating speed/output rotating speed=Z11⁢Z11-tooth-number of inner gear ring×Z23/Z23+Z24=14/14-49+shift level number×16/56=-49/shift level number
Wherein: forward shift levels are 1, 2, 3...20; reverse shift levels are -1, -2 and -3.

The negative value of the transmission ratio shows the opposite directions of input and output rotation. Therefore, the ratio of the first level and the 20th level of forward shift is 20 times. Due to the multiple shifts, the difference of output rotating speeds between adjacent shifts is slim, so the variable transmission can realize direct shifting without the coordination of the clutch during medium or high speed, except the starting stage. Springs are used to buffer shifting impact, so as to achieve low-loss shifting without power interruption.

As shown in FIGS. 10∼12, the difference between the variable transmission of this Embodiment and that in Embodiment 1 is the lack of rear-mounted planetary gear train. The transmission in this Embodiment comprises an inner gear ring B with variable tooth-number and a planetary gear train coaxially disposed inside, wherein the planetary gear train is composed of a main sun gear 11, an inner planetary gear 12 and an outer planetary gear 13. The main sun gear 11 is coaxially disposed between the pair of tapered discs 7, 8, and the inner planetary gear 12 is engaged with the main sun gear 11 through the bracket of the main planetary gear carrier 14; the outer planetary gear 13 is provided with pinions P coaxially connected; the shafts of the inner, outer planetary gears 12, 13 are articulated with each other through the connecting arm 15 of the planetary gear, and the inner planetary gear 12 keeps engagement with the pinions P; the outer planetary gear 13 is engaged with the inner gear ring B; the main planetary gear carrier 14 is linked with the power input part 20, and the main sun gear 11 is connected with the power output part 21.

If the tooth-number ZB of the inner gear ring B takes 46∼69, that of the outer planetary gear 13 Z13=20, that of the main sun gear 11 Z11=30, that of the pinions P ZP =12: when ZB is 51∼69, ZB/Z13 > Z11/ZP, the directions of the input and output rotation are opposite, 19 steps of speeds are available, which are used as the forward shift; when ZB is 46∼49, ZB/Z13 < Z11/ZP, the directions of the input and output rotation are the same, 4 steps of speeds are available, which are used as the reverse shift; when ZB = 50, it is shift "0", namely, brake for locking, at this time, the output speed keeps 0 no matter how much rotating speed you input. The transmission ratio of various shifts is: Input rotating speed/output rotating speed=1/1-ZP×ZB/Z11×Z13=1/(1-(12×50+shift level number/30×20=-50/shift level number

Wherein: forward shift levels are 1, 2, 3...19; reverse shift levels are -1, -2, -3 and -4; the negative value of the transmission ratio shows the opposite directions of input and output rotation. The ratio of the first level and the 19th level of forward shift is 19 times. Due to the multiple shifts, the difference of output rotating speeds between adjacent shifts is slim, so the variable transmission can realize direct shifting without the coordination of the clutch during medium or high speed, except starting stage as described in Embodiment 1. Torque springs are used to buffer shifting impact, so as to achieve low-loss shifting without power interruption.

As shown in FIG. 9, the difference between the variable transmission of this Embodiment and that in Embodiment 1 is that the inner gear ring B is formed by two sections of rack 3 through the connection of both ends in ring-shaped form, wherein the rear section of the first section of the rack leads out from the gear ring connecting interface at the front end of the second section of the rack, the rear end of the second section of the rack leads out from the gear ring connecting interface at the front end of the first section of the rack, and two pairs of inner, outer planetary gears are equipped to balance the center of gravity for eliminating rotating vibration and to bear higher torque. In all the abovementioned embodiments, an inner gear ring with variable tooth-number is adopted. Such inner gear ring can not only be applied to the aforesaid variable transmission, but also to other shift or transmission mechanisms. For instance, through the engagement of the inner gear ring B with the outer planetary gear 13 of the planetary gear train, and driving by the revolution of the outer planetary gear 13, the rack is driven to push or draw out teeth 1 into or from the inner gear ring B after the outer planetary gear 13 passes through the gear ring connecting interfaces A during rotation. Meanwhile the two tapered discs 7, 8 are driven to make axial movement to change the adjacent distance, in this way, to keep the inner gear ring contacting the inner walls of the two tapered discs 7, 8 all the time, and closely contacting between the facing walls of the two tapered discs 7, 8 in the form of circular ring shape, the increase or decrease of tooth-number of the inner gear ring B is completed before the outer planetary gear 13 rotates to the gear ring connecting interfaces A for the next time.

As shown in Figure 13 and 14, wherein Figure 13 shows the condition when the inner gear ring B is the minimum and Figure 14 shows the condition when the inner gear ring B is the maximum. The variable transmission of this Embodiment comprises a main planetary gear train and a post planetary gear train, wherein the main planetary gear train comprises an inner gear ring B with variable tooth-number, a planetary gear 13, a planetary gear carrier 14 and a supporting sliding rail 17; the supporting sliding rail 17 can rotate around the axis of the tapered discs 7, 8, and make axial movement along with the tapered disc of the same side, the included angle between the supporting sliding rail 17 and the axis of the tapered discs is equal to or similar to the semi-tapered angle of the inner walls 9 of the tapered discs; the planetary gear carrier 41 slides along with the supporting sliding rail 17, and the planetary gear 13 keeps engagement with the inner gear ring B. The post planetary gear train comprises a post planetary gear 43, a post gear ring 44 and a post planetary gear carrier 42; the post planetary gear 43 is engaged with the post gear ring 44; the planetary gear 13 is connected with the post planetary gear 43 through a universal coupling 45; the post planetary gear carrier 42 is provided with axial sliding rail 46; the supporting sliding rail 17 follows the tapered disc 7 or 8 of the same side to move along the axial sliding rail 46 and follows the post planetary gear carrier 42 to rotate around the axis of the tapered disc; the post planetary gear carrier 42 is connected with the power input part 20, and the post gearing ring 44 is connected with the power output part 21.
Suppose the tooth-number of the inner gear ring B is ZB, that of the planetary gear 13 is Z13, that of the post gear ring 44 is Z44 and that of the post planetary gear 43 is Z43, then: Input rotating speed/output rotating speed=1/1-ZB×Z43/Z13×Z44
If the tooth-number ZB of the inner gear ring B takes 27 ∼ 49, that of the planetary gear 13 Z13=22, that of the post gear ring 44 Z44=45, that of the post planetary gear 43 Z43 =22: when ZB = 45, the output speed is kept at 0, shift "0" indicates the brake for locking; when ZB is 44 ∼ 27, the directions of the input and output rotation are the same, 18 steps of speeds are available, which are used as the forward shift; when ZB is 46∼49, the directions of the input and output rotation are opposite, 4 steps of speeds are available, which are used as the reverse shift. The transmission ratio is expressed as follows by means of shifts: Input rotating speed/output rotating speed=1/1-45-shift level number/45=45/shift level number
Wherein: forward shift levels are 1, 2...18; reverse shift levels are -1, -2, -3 and -4.
If the tooth-number ZB of the inner gear ring B takes 27 ∼ 49, that of the planetary gear 13 Z13=22, that of the post gear ring 44 Z44=31, that of the post planetary gear 43 Z43 =22: when ZB = 31, the output speed keeps 0, shift "0" indicates the brake for locking; when ZB is 32 ∼ 49, the directions of the input and output rotation are opposite, 18 steps of speeds are available, which are used as the forward shift; when ZB is 30 - 27, the directions of the input and output rotation are the same, 4 steps of speeds are available, which are used as the reverse shift. Then: Input rotating speed/output rotating speed=1/1-31+shift level number/31=-31/shift level number
Wherein: forward shift levels are 1, 2...18; reverse shift levels are -1, -2, -3 and -4.

claim.claim-text:
Getriebeinnenring mit variabler Zahnanzahl, umfassend ein Paar kegelstumpfförmige Scheiben (7, 8), die koaxial angebracht sind und ihren Abstand zueinander in Achsenrichtung durch Bewegung in Bezug zueinander verändern können, wobei die Innenwände (9) der zwei kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) nach innen zu konkav sind und einander gegenüberliegen, und einen aus mehreren Zähnen (1) bestehenden gewundenen Strang (3), der zwischen die beiden sich gegenüberliegenden Wände der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) eingebracht ist, wobei Zahnräder (2) auf die Zähne (1) aufgesetzt sind,
wobei der hintere Abschnitt (5) des Strangs (3) aus schmalen Zähnen besteht und der vordere Abschnitt (4) des Strangs (3) aus breiten Zähnen besteht, die beiden Seitenflächen des Strangs (3) in engem Kontakt mit den Innenwänden (9) der beiden kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) stehen, die Innenwände (9) der beiden kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben mit konkaven Flächen (10) versehen sind, die für die breiten Zähne geeignet sind, so dass der Getriebeinnenring (B) veranlasst wird, eine kreisförmige Gestalt beizubehalten, und die Zahnanzahl des Getriebeinnenrings (B), die der hintere Abschnitt (5) des Strangs (3) in dem oder außerhalb des Getriebeinnenring(s) (B) ist, mit der Veränderung des relativen Abstands zwischen den beiden kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) variiert,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass: der vordere Abschnitt (4) des Strangs (3) mit Getriebering-verbindenden Zwischenstücken (A) versehen ist für den Eintritt des hinteren Abschnitts (5) des Strangs (3), der durch die verbindenden Zwischenstücke (A) hindurchgeht und den kreisförmigen Getriebeinnenring (B) bildet, wobei die Getriebering-verbindenden Zwischenstücke (A) von den ersten breiten Zähnen (6) gebildet werden, die die Form eines "n" haben, durch die der hintere Abschnitt (5) hindurchgeht,
wobei die Höhe der "n"-förmigen breiten Zähne vom Vorderende des Strangs (3) nach hinten zunimmt und der hintere Abschnitt (5) des Strangs durch die Zwischenstücke (A) an einer Tangente an den Getriebeinnenring (B) hindurchgeht.
Getriebeinnenring mit variabler Zahnanzahl nach Anspruch 1, wobei der Getriebeinnenring (B) zwei Abschnitte an Strang (3) enthält, die ringförmig miteinander verbunden sind.
Getriebebaugruppe mit einem Getriebeinnenring nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche und einem Planetengetriebezug (11-13), der im Inneren des Rings angeordnet ist.

Verfahren zum Variieren der Zahnanzahl bei einer Getriebeinnenring-Baugruppe mit variabler Zahnanzahl nach Anspruch 3, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der Getriebeinnenring (B) in Eingriff genommen und angetrieben wird durch ein äußeres Planetenrad (13) des Planetengetriebezugs mittels Umdrehung, wobei der hintere Abschnitt (5) des Strangs (3) derart angetrieben wird, dass er Zähne in den Getriebeinnenring (B) schiebt oder Zähne aus dem Getriebeinnenring (B) zieht, nachdem das äußere Planetenrad (13) während der Umdrehung durch die Getriebering-verbindenden Zwischenstücke (A) hindurchgeht, und währenddessen die beiden kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) derart angetrieben werden, dass sie eine Relativbewegung in Achsenrichtung ausführen und so ihren Abstand voneinander verändern, so dass sichergestellt wird, dass der Getriebeinnenring während der gesamten Zeit in Kontakt mit den Innenwänden der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben steht und zwischen den sich gegenüberliegenden Wänden der beiden kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) in Form eines kreisförmigen Rings festgehalten wird, wobei die Erhöhung oder Verringerung der Zahnanzahl des Getriebeinnenrings (B) beendet ist, bevor das äußere Planetenrad (13) durch die Getriebering-verbindenden Zwischenstücke (A) während der nächsten Umdrehung hindurchgeht.

Variable Übersetzung unter Verwendung der Getriebeinnenring-Baugruppe mit variabler Zahnanzahl nach Anspruch 3, die zudem ein Hauptschaltteil und einen Schaltmechanismus enthält, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das Hauptschaltteil den Planetengetriebezug (11-13) als Hauptplanetengetriebezug enthält, der den Schaltmechanismus antreibt und einen Getriebeinnenring (B) mit variabler Zahnanzahl enthält, und der Getriebeinnenring (B) mit variabler Zahnanzahl den Getriebering des Hauptplanetengetriebezugs bildet, wobei das Übersetzungsverhältnis des Hauptplanetengetriebezugs mit der Veränderung der Zahnanzahl des Getriebeinnenrings (B) variiert.

Variable Übersetzung nach Anspruch 5, wobei der Hauptplanetengetriebezug ein Hauptsonnenrad (11), ein inneres Planetenrad (12) und ein äußeres Planetenrad (13) umfasst, wobei das Hauptsonnenrad (11) koaxial zwischen die kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) eingebracht ist, das innere Planetenrad (12) mit dem Hauptsonnenrad (11) durch eine Klammer eines Hauptplanetenradträgers (14) in Eingriff steht, die Wellen des inneren und äußeren Planetenrads (12, 13) über einen Planetenradverbindungsarm (15) beweglich verbunden sind, so dass die beiden Räder (12, 13) miteinander im Eingriff bleiben, und das äußere Planetenrad (13) mit dem Getriebeinnenring (B) in Eingriff steht, wobei das Übersetzungsverhältnis zwischen dem Hauptplanetenradträger (14) und dem Hauptsonnenrad (11) mit der Veränderung der Zahnanzahl des Getriebeinnenrings (B) variiert.

Variable Übersetzung nach Anspruch 6, wobei das äußere Planetenrad (13) mit dem Getriebeinnenring (B) direkt in Eingriff steht durch den Widerstand, der durch Lasten und umlaufende Fliehkraft erzeugt wird, oder durch einen Stützmechanismus (D).

Variable Übersetzung nach Anspruch 7, wobei der Stützmechanismus (D) des äußeren Planetenrads (13) aus einem Stützarm (16), einem Stützschiebeblock (18) und einer Stützschiebeschiene (17) besteht, wobei ein Ende des Stützarms (16) mit dem Verbindungsarm (15) des Planetenrads verbunden ist, das andere Ende des Arms (16) mit dem Schiebeblock (18) gelenkig verbunden ist, die Gelenkverbindung koaxial mit dem äußeren Planetenrad (13) ist, die Stützschiebeschiene (17) und die Welle der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) sich auf derselben Seite befinden und die Schiene um die Welle der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) rotieren kann, der Winkel, der zwischen der Stützschiebeschiene (17) und der Welle der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) eingeschlossen wird, gleich dem halben Abflachungswinkel der Innenwand (9) der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheibe (7 oder 8) ist und sich in Achsenrichtung mit der kegelstumpfförmigen Scheibe (7 oder 8) derselben Seite bewegt, wobei der Schiebeblock (18) an der Stützschiebeschiene (17) entlang gleitet und das äußere Planetenrad (13) während der gesamt Zeit mit dem Getriebeinnenring (B) in Eingriff steht.

Variable Übersetzung nach einem der Ansprüche 6 bis 8, wobei das Hauptsonnenrad (11) mit dem Krafteinlassteil (20) verbunden ist und der Hauptplanetenradträger (14) mit dem Kraftauslassteil (21) verbunden ist oder umgekehrt.

Variable Übersetzung nach Anspruch 9, wobei ein Nach-Planetengetriebezug (22) zwischen dem Planetengetriebezug und dem Kraftauslassteil (21) gebildet wird, wobei der Nach-Planetengetriebezug (22) ein Ein-Ritzel-Planetengetriebezug ist und aus einem Sonnenrad (23), einem Getriebering (24) und einem Planetenradträger (25) besteht, wobei das Hauptsonnenrad (11) mit dem Sonnenrad (23) verbunden ist, der Hauptplanetenradträger (14) mit dem Getriebering (24) verbunden ist, das Hauptsonnenrad (11) oder der Hauptplanetenradträger (14) mit dem Krafteinlassteil (20) verbunden ist und der Planetenradträger (25) des Nach-Planetengetriebezugs (22) mit dem Kraftauslassteil (21) verbunden ist.

Variable Übersetzung nach Anspruch 5, wobei der Hauptplanetengetriebezug ein Hauptsonnenrad (11), ein inneres Planetenrad (12) und ein äußeres Planetenrad (13) umfasst, wobei das Hauptsonnenrad (11) koaxial zwischen die kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) eingebracht ist, das innere Planetenrad (12) mit dem Hauptsonnenrad (11) durch eine Klammer des Hauptplanetenradträgers (14) in Eingriff steht, Ritzel (P) mit den äußeren Planetenrädern (13) koaxial verbunden sind, die Wellen des inneren und äußeren Planetenrads (12, 13) über einen Planetenradverbindungsarm (15) gelenkig sind und das innere Planetenrad (12) mit den Ritzeln (P) in Eingriff steht, das äußere Planetenrad (13) mit dem Getriebeinnenring (B) in Eingriff steht, der Hauptplanetenradträger (14) mit dem Krafteinlassteil (20) verbunden ist und das Hauptsonnenrad (11) mit dem Kraftauslassteil (21) verbunden ist.

Variable Übersetzung nach einem der Ansprüche 5 bis 11, wobei eine Zugvorrichtung zwischen dem Schaltmechanismus und dem Getriebeinnenring (B) angeordnet ist, wobei die Zugvorrichtung eine Zähne-leitende Rillenschiene (26) und eine Zugstange (27) umfasst, wobei die Zähne-leitende Rillenschiene (26) in Richtung der Tangente an den Getriebeinnenring (B) verläuft und mit dem ersten Zahn (6) am vorderen Abschnitt des Strangs (3) verbunden ist und eine radiale Bewegung mit dem Zahn (6) ausführt, die Zugstange (27) in der Ebene des Wellenabschnitts in der Mitte des Getriebeinnenrings (B) und in die Richtung in einem Winkel von arctan (0,5/π) zu der Zähne-leitenden Rillenschiene (26) angeordnet ist und mit den schmalen Zähnen am hinteren Abschnitt (5) des Strangs (3) verbunden ist und sich in diese Richtung unter dem Zug des Schaltmechanismus bewegt, wobei die Bewegung der Zugstange (27) entlang der Einstellrichtung, dem hinteren Abschnitt (5) des Strangs, durch die Getriebering-verbindenden Zwischenstücke (A) durch Herausziehen oder Hineinschieben von Zähnen in den oder aus dem Getriebeinnenring (B) durch Gleiten in der Zähne-leitenden Rillenschiene (26) erfolgt und die Zähne-leitende Rillenschiene (26) derart antreibt, dass diese eine radiale Bewegung entlang des ersten Zahns (6) am vorderen Abschnitt des Strangs ausführt und sich so an die Veränderung des Radius des Getriebeinnenrings (B) anpasst.

Variable Übersetzung nach Anspruch 12, wobei in den kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) Schraubenlöcher gesetzt sind und die Schraubenlöcher durch die Schrauben (19) mit gegenläufigen Gewinden an beiden Enden verbunden werden, wobei die Schrauben (19) zusammen mit der Bewegung der Zugstange (27) rotieren und der relative Abstand zwischen den beiden kegelstumpfförmigen Scheiben (7, 8) sich mit der Rotation der Schrauben (19) verändert.
An inner gear ring with variable tooth-number as claimed in Claim 1, in which the inner gear ring (B) includes two sections of rack (3) connected in ring-shaped form.
A gear assembly including an inner gear ring according to either preceding claim, and a planetary gear train (11-13) arranged inside the ring.

A method of varying the tooth-number for an inner gear ring assembly with variable tooth-number as claimed in Claim 3, characterized in that the inner gear ring (B) is engaged with and driven by an outer planetary gear (13) of the planetary gear train through revolution, the rear section (5) of the rack (3) is driven to push teeth into or draw teeth out from the inner gear ring (B) after the outer planetary gear (13) passes through the gear ring connecting interfaces (A) during revolution, and meanwhile the two tapered discs (7, 8) are driven to make relative movement along the axial direction to change their mutual distance, so as to ensure that the inner gear ring is in contact with the inner walls of the tapered discs all the time, and closely contacted between the facing walls of the two tapered discs (7, 8) in the form of a circular ring, the increase or decrease of tooth-number of the inner gear ring (B) being completed before the outer planetary gear (13) passes through the gear ring connecting interfaces (A) during the next revolution.

A variable transmission using the inner gear ring assembly with variable tooth-number according to claim 3, further including a main shift part and a shift mechanism, characterized in that the main shift part includes the planetary gear train (11-13) as a main planetary gear train driving the shift mechanism and containing an inner gear ring (B) with variable tooth-number, and the inner gear ring (B) with variable tooth-number forms the gear ring of the main planetary gear train, the transmission ratio of the main planetary gear train varying with the change of the tooth-number of the inner gear ring (B).

A variable transmission as claimed in Claim 5, in which the main planetary gear train comprises a main sun gear (11), an inner planetary gear (12) and an outer planetary gear (13); wherein the main sun gear (11) is coaxially disposed between the tapered discs (7, 8), the inner planetary gear (12) is engaged with the main sun gear (11) through a bracket of a main planetary gear carrier (14); the shafts of the inner and outer planetary gears (12, 13) are articulated via a planetary gear connecting arm (15) so that the two gears (12, 13) keep engaged with each other, and the outer planetary gear (13) is engaged with the inner gear ring (B); wherein the transmission ratio between the main planetary gear carrier (14) and the main sun gear (11) varies with the change of the tooth-number of the inner gear ring (B).

A variable transmission as claimed in Claim 6, in which the outer planetary gear (13) is directly engaged with the inner gear ring (B) through the resistance generated by loads and rotating centrifugal force, or through a supporting mechanism (D).

A variable transmission as claimed in Claim 7, in which the supporting mechanism (D) of the outer planetary gear consists of a supporting arm (16), a supporting sliding block (18) and a supporting sliding rail (17); one end of the supporting arm (16) is connected to the connecting arm (15) of the planetary gear, the other end of the arm (16) is articulated with the sliding block (18), the articulation is coaxial with the outer planetary gear (13); the supporting sliding rail (17) and the shaft of the tapered discs (7, 8) are on the same face and the rail can rotate around the shaft of the tapered discs (7, 8), the included angle between the supporting sliding rail (17) and the shaft of the tapered discs (7, 8) is equal to the semi-tapered angle of the inner wall (9) of the tapered disc (7 or 8) and moves axially with the tapered disc (7 or 8) of the same side; the sliding block (18) slides along the supporting sliding rail (17), and the outer planetary gear (13) is engaged with the inner gear ring (B) all the time.

A variable transmission as claimed in any of Claims 6 to 8, in which the main sun gear (11) is connected with the power input part (20) and the main planetary gear carrier (14) is connected with the power output part (21), or vice versa.

A variable transmission as claimed in Claim 9, in which a post planetary gear train (22) is configured between the planetary gear train and power output part (21); the post planetary gear train (22) is a single-pinion-type planetary gear train, and is composed of a sun gear (23), a gear ring (24) and a planetary gear carrier (25); the main sun gear (11) is connected with the sun gear (23), the main planetary gear carrier (14) is linked with the gear ring (24); the main sun gear (11) or main planetary gear carrier (14) is connected with the power input part (20), and the planetary gear carrier (25) of the post planetary gear train (22) is connected with the power output part (21).

A variable transmission as claimed in Claim 5, in which the main planetary gear train comprises a main sun gear (11), an inner planetary gear (12) and an outer planetary gear (13); wherein the main sun gear (11) is coaxially disposed between the tapered discs (7, 8); the inner planetary gear (12) is engaged with the main sun gear (11) through the bracket of the main planetary gear carrier (14); pinions (P) are connected with the outer planetary gears (13) coaxially; the shafts of the inner and outer planetary gears (12, 13) are articulated via a planetary gear connecting arm (15) and the inner planetary gear (12) is engaged with the pinions (P); the outer planetary gear (13) is engaged with the inner gear ring (B); the main planetary gear carrier (14) is connected with the power input part (20), and the main sun gear (11) is linked with the power output part (21).

A variable transmission as claimed in any one of Claims 5 to 11, in which a traction device is arranged between the shift mechanism and inner gear ring (B), wherein the traction device comprises a tooth guiding grooved rail (26) and a traction rod (27); the tooth guiding grooved rail (26) is arranged along the tangent direction of the inner gear ring (B) and connected with the first tooth (6) at the front section of the rack (3), and makes radial movement with the tooth (6); the traction rod (27) is arranged on the plane of the shaft section in the center of the inner gear ring (B) and along the direction at an angle of arctan (0.5/π) to the tooth guiding grooved rail (26), and connected with the narrow teeth at the rear section (5) of the rack (3), and moves along this direction under the traction of the shift mechanism; with the traction rod (27) movement along the setting direction, the rear section (5) of the rack through the gear ring connecting interfaces (A) by means of drawing out or pushing in teeth is in or out of the inner gear ring (B) via the sliding in the tooth guiding grooved rail (26), and drives the tooth guiding grooved rail (26) to make radial movement along the first tooth (6) at the front section of the rack so as to adapt to the change of the radius of the inner gear ring (B).

A variable transmission as claimed in Claim 12, in which screw holes are set in the tapered discs (7, 8), the screw holes are connected by the screws (19) with opposite threads on both ends, wherein the screws (19) rotates along with the movement of the traction rod (27), and the relative distance between the two tapered discs (7, 8) varies with the rotation of the screws (19).

Couronne à denture intérieure à nombre de dents variable selon la revendication 1, dans laquelle la couronne à denture intérieure (B) comprend deux sections de crémaillère (3) reliées en une forme annulaire.
Ensemble d'engrenages comprenant une couronne à denture intérieure selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, et un train planétaire (11 à 13) agencé à l'intérieur de la couronne.

Procédé de changement du nombre de dents pour un ensemble de couronne à denture intérieure à nombre de dents variable selon la revendication 3, caractérisé en ce que la couronne à denture intérieure (B) est en prise avec et entraînée par un satellite extérieur (13) du train planétaire par rotation, la section arrière (5) de la crémaillère (3) est entraînée pour pousser des dents dans ou retirer des dents de la couronne à denture intérieure (B) après que le satellite extérieur (13) est passé à travers les interfaces de liaison (A) de la couronne pendant une rotation, et pendant ce temps les deux disques coniques (7, 8) sont entraînés pour effectuer un déplacement relatif dans la direction axiale pour changer leur distance mutuelle, de manière à garantir que la couronne à denture intérieure est tout le temps en contact avec les parois intérieures des disques coniques, et étroitement en contact entre les parois se faisant face des deux disques coniques (7, 8) sous la forme d'une couronne circulaire, l'augmentation ou la diminution du nombre de dents de la couronne à denture intérieure (B) étant achevée avant que le satellite extérieur (13) passe à travers les interfaces de liaison (A) de la couronne pendant la rotation suivante.

Transmission variable utilisant l'ensemble de couronne à denture intérieure à nombre de dents variable selon la revendication 3, comprenant en outre une partie de changement de vitesse principale et un mécanisme de changement de vitesse, caractérisée en ce que la partie de changement de vitesse principale comprend le train planétaire (11 à 13) en tant que train planétaire principal entraînant le mécanisme de changement de vitesse et contenant une couronne à denture intérieure (B) à nombre de dents variable, et la couronne à denture intérieure (B) à nombre de dents variable forme la couronne du train planétaire principal, le rapport de transmission du train planétaire principal variant avec le changement du nombre de dents de la couronne à denture intérieure (B).

Transmission variable selon la revendication 5, dans laquelle le train planétaire principal comprend un planétaire principal (11), un satellite intérieur (12) et un satellite extérieur (13) ; dans laquelle le planétaire principal (11) est disposé coaxialement entre les disques coniques (7, 8), le satellite intérieur (12) est en prise avec le planétaire principal (11) par l'intermédiaire d'un support d'un porte-satellite principal (14) ; les arbres des satellites intérieur et extérieur (12, 13) sont articulés par l'intermédiaire d'un bras de liaison de satellite (15) de sorte que les deux pignons (12, 13) restent en prise l'un avec l'autre, et que le satellite extérieur (13) soit en prise avec la couronne à denture intérieure (B) ; dans laquelle le rapport de transmission entre le porte-satellite principal (14) et le planétaire principal (11) varie avec le changement du nombre de dents de la couronne à denture intérieure (B).

Transmission variable selon la revendication 6, dans laquelle le satellite extérieur (13) est directement en prise avec la couronne à denture intérieure (B) par l'intermédiaire de la résistance générée par des charges et une force centrifuge de rotation, ou par l'intermédiaire d'un mécanisme de support (D).

Transmission variable selon la revendication 7, dans laquelle le mécanisme de support (D) du satellite extérieur consiste en un bras de support (16), un bloc coulissant de support (18) et un rail de coulissement de support (17) ; une extrémité du bras de support (16) est reliée au bras de liaison (15) du satellite, l'autre extrémité du bras (16) est articulée avec le bloc coulissant (18), l'articulation est coaxiale avec le satellite extérieur (13) ; le rail de coulissement de support (17) et l'arbre des disques coniques (7, 8) sont sur la même face et le rail peut tourner autour de l'arbre des disques coniques (7, 8), l'angle inclus entre le rail de coulissement de support (17) et l'arbre des disques coniques (7, 8) est égal à l'angle semi-conique de la paroi interne (9) du disque conique (7 ou 8) et se déplace axialement avec le disque conique (7 ou 8) du même côté ; le bloc coulissant (18) coulisse le long du rail de coulissement de support (17), et le satellite extérieur (13) est tout le temps en prise avec la couronne à denture intérieure (B).

Transmission variable selon l'une quelconque des revendications 6 à 8, dans laquelle le planétaire principal (11) est reliée à la partie d'entrée de puissance (20) et le porte-satellite principal (14) est relié à la partie de sortie de puissance (21), ou vice versa.

Transmission variable selon la revendication 9, dans laquelle le train post planétaire (22) est configuré entre le train planétaire et la partie de sortie de puissance (21) ; le train post planétaire (22) est un train planétaire de type à pignon unique, et est composé d'un planétaire (23), d'une couronne (24) et d'un porte-satellite (25) ; le planétaire principal (11) est relié au planétaire (23), le porte-satellite principal (14) est relié à la couronne (24) ; le planétaire principal (11) ou le porte-satellite principal (14) est relié à la partie d'entrée de puissance (20), et le porte-satellite (25) du train post planétaire (22) est relié à la partie de sortie de puissance (21).

Transmission variable selon la revendication 5, dans laquelle le train planétaire principal comprend un planétaire principal (11), un satellite intérieur (12) et un satellite extérieur (13) ; dans laquelle le planétaire principal (11) est disposé coaxialement entre les disques coniques (7, 8) ; le satellite intérieur (12) est en prise avec le planétaire principal (11) par l'intermédiaire du support du porte-satellite principal (14) ; des pignons (P) sont reliés aux satellites extérieurs (13) coaxialement ; les arbres des satellites intérieur et extérieur (12, 13) sont articulés par l'intermédiaire d'un bras de liaison de satellite (15) et le satellite intérieur (12) est en prise avec les pignons (P) ; le satellite extérieur (13) est en prise avec la couronne à denture intérieure (B) ; le porte-satellite principal (14) est relié à la partie d'entrée de puissance (20), et le planétaire principal (11) est relié à la partie de sortie de puissance (21).

Transmission variable selon l'une quelconque des revendications 5 à 11, dans laquelle un dispositif de traction est agencé entre le mécanisme de changement de vitesse et la couronne à denture intérieure (B), dans laquelle le dispositif de traction comprend un rail rainuré de guidage de dent (26) et une tige de traction (27) ; le rail rainuré de guidage de dent (26) est agencé le long de la direction de tangente de la couronne à denture intérieure (B) et relié à la première dent (6) au niveau de la section avant de la crémaillère (3), et effectue un déplacement radial avec la dent (6) ; la tige de traction (27) est agencée sur le plan de la section d'arbre au centre de la couronne à denture intérieure (B) et le long de la direction formant un angle arctg (0,5/π) avec le rail rainuré de guidage de dent (26), et reliée aux dents étroites au niveau de la section arrière (5) de la crémaillère (3), et se déplace le long de cette direction sous la traction du mécanisme de changement de vitesse ; avec le déplacement de la tige de traction (27) le long de la direction de réglage, la section arrière (5) de la crémaillère à travers les interfaces de liaison (A) de la couronne au moyen de la traction ou de la poussée des dents est dans ou hors de la couronne à denture intérieure (B) par l'intermédiaire du coulissement dans le rail rainuré de guidage de dent (26), et entraîne le rail rainuré de guidage de dent (26) pour effectuer un déplacement radial le long de la première dent (6) au niveau de la section avant de la crémaillère de manière à s'adapter au changement du rayon de la couronne à denture intérieure (B).

Transmission variable selon la revendication 12, dans laquelle des trous filetés sont prévus dans les disques coniques (7, 8), les trous filetés sont reliés par les vis (19) avec des filetages opposés aux deux extrémités, dans laquelle les vis (19) tournent avec le déplacement de la tige de traction (27), et la distance relative entre les deux disques coniques (7, 8) varie avec la rotation des vis (19).
